original_title: Sri Lanka’s mid day stocks edge up as tourism pick dragged by financials
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edge up in mid day trade on Monday as the holiday season comes to an end and expectations of the high profits in tourism stocks out pay the negative impact of potential domestic debt restructuring, an analyst said.
“Investor interest comes from the tourism sector providing favorable figures on income and arrivals,” the analyst said.
The All Share Price Index (ASPI) was marginally up 0.09 percent or 8.31 points to 9,423.59, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 0.49 percent or 13.55 points to 2,767.78.
Turnover generated was set on moderate levels, with turnover coming up to 842 million rupees at 1230 hours.
Top gainers during mid day trade were Expolanka, Aitken Spence and Lanka IOC.
Expolanka has been a top gainer, due to anticipations and expectations that SJ Holdings may resurface and buy Expolanka.

Lanka IOC has been gaining as global oil prices surge up, having investors hoping that margins are to increase and local oil prices will increase alongside global prices, an analyst said. (Colombo/April17/2023)
